    Worked okay for 15-days", "rating": 1, "date": "Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2022", "body": "I bought this 15-days ago.  It worked fine for the first 14-days.  I bought it just to browse the web and run a Pico Oscilloscope, it did both very well.  On the fifteen day I started the computer and Nord VPN, which starts automatically, wouldn't start.  Instead, I got "Runtime error 5:252".  I looked on line for a solution and found that I should reload Nord VPN, but first I chatted with Nord; they couldn't help me and suggested I remove the APP and re-install.  I did, I removed the Nord APP, but on trying to re-install I got the same Runtime Error 5:252.  Then I tried to start my Oscilloscope APP and it wouldn't start, and I got the same Runtime Error 5:252.  So I looked to see if my windows was up to date, it is.  Looking online again, it was suggested to reload Windows itself; I did.  I then tried to reload Nord and got the same Runtime Error.  So, it's likely the computer itself.  I know this is a cheap computer, but I wasn't expecting much, and it did everything I wanted it to do, except keep running for more then 14-days. I'm tired of MS computers, they're always broken, and I spend too much time fixing and reinstalling drivers and software, etc... I swore I never would, but I'm looking to buy an Apple now.", "helpfulVotes": 3}, {"title": "3.0 out of 5 stars

    Never could disable S Mode", "rating": 2, "date": "Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022", "body": "For those who don’t know, Windows S Mode essentially stops you from installing anything other than apps purchased directly from the Windows store. That means no Google Chrome browser, no Kapersky antivirus, etc.You are *supposed* to be able to easily disable S Mode in Windows, but HP has apparently disabled that option on this model laptop.I spent hours trying to disable it, watching every Youtube video, reading every Microsoft help document, etc. I did system recovery. I tried everything I could think of, to no avail.This was supposed to be a gift for my girlfriend, so she could work remotely. But since I couldn’t disable S Mode, there’s no way for her office to install their software clients on it. So it became pointless.Avoid this mode unless you want a crippled computer.", "helpfulVotes": 2}, {"title": "5.0 out of 5 stars
